trans-unit.source: Microsoft Project Integration

seg-source.mrk: Microsoft Project Integration

trans-unit.source: For more complex planning needs, cc|project integrates with Microsoft Project, thereby allowing project plans to be exported from cc|project into Microsoft Project though a bi-directional interface. From there, project plans can be modified and then returned to cc|project.

seg-source.mrk: For more complex planning needs, cc|project integrates with Microsoft Project, thereby allowing project plans to be exported from cc|project into Microsoft Project though a bi-directional interface.
From there, project plans can be modified and then returned to cc|project.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, complete project structures can be defined in Microsoft Project and then imported back into cc|project and/or section of project structures.

seg-source.mrk: Additionally, complete project structures can be defined in Microsoft Project and then imported back into cc|project and/or section of project structures.

trans-unit.source: Considerations for Microsoft Project Interface

seg-source.mrk: Considerations for Microsoft Project Interface

trans-unit.source: It is important to consider that there are two complex systems with separate logics (data export and data import). The interface is a great challenge for cc|project, because as many structures as possible are integrated from Microsoft Project in cc|project. But in some places compromises are needed because not all can be integrated 100%.

seg-source.mrk: It is important to consider that there are two complex systems with separate logics (data export and data import).
The interface is a great challenge for cc|project, because as many structures as possible are integrated from Microsoft Project in cc|project.
But in some places compromises are needed because not all can be integrated 100%.

trans-unit.source: In practice it is necessary to adjust the interface data. There are some issues in different areas; the most important issues are described in the following sections.

seg-source.mrk: In practice it is necessary to adjust the interface data.
There are some issues in different areas; the most important issues are described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Export to Microsoft Project

seg-source.mrk: Export to Microsoft Project

trans-unit.source: This section explains the considerations for exporting to Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: This section explains the considerations for exporting to Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source: Limitation

seg-source.mrk: Limitation

trans-unit.source: Considerations

seg-source.mrk: Considerations

trans-unit.source: Structures

seg-source.mrk: Structures

trans-unit.source: In cc|project, a process can be a normal process and a summary process at the same time. The reason for this is that a process can have a sub-structure – and on the other side, the process can be a planning process itself because there is time to plan from a remaining quantity.

seg-source.mrk: In cc|project, a process can be a normal process and a summary process at the same time.
The reason for this is that a process can have a sub-structure – and on the other side, the process can be a planning process itself because there is time to plan from a remaining quantity.

trans-unit.source: In Microsoft Project, both functions are not possible.

seg-source.mrk: In Microsoft Project, both functions are not possible.

trans-unit.source: The structure must be checked before export and some processes may need to be split into two processes.

seg-source.mrk: The structure must be checked before export and some processes may need to be split into two processes.

trans-unit.source: Calendar Entries

seg-source.mrk: Calendar Entries

trans-unit.source: Calendar entries can be exported from cc|project to Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: Calendar entries can be exported from cc|project to Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source: In cc|project, the calendar entries are administered independently from processes. Volitional dependencies will calculate by special functions, such as the Finish date of a process by using Effort Driven processes.

seg-source.mrk: In cc|project, the calendar entries are administered independently from processes.
Volitional dependencies will calculate by special functions, such as the Finish date of a process by using Effort Driven processes.

trans-unit.source: However, the interface needs to exactly match the calendar entries with the existing duration. If there are differences, Microsoft Project will calculate with own logic. This is a technical issue, but it’s important to know there could be problems.

seg-source.mrk: However, the interface needs to exactly match the calendar entries with the existing duration.
If there are differences, Microsoft Project will calculate with own logic.
This is a technical issue, but it’s important to know there could be problems.

trans-unit.source: Actual Work

seg-source.mrk: Actual Work

trans-unit.source: In principle, this option has the same conventions as the calendar entries, but it is more difficult. The combinations of exiting calendar entries and actual work make the interface more complex.

seg-source.mrk: In principle, this option has the same conventions as the calendar entries, but it is more difficult.
The combinations of exiting calendar entries and actual work make the interface more complex.

trans-unit.source: Web Client / Mobile Application

seg-source.mrk: Web Client / Mobile Application

trans-unit.source: When using the Web Client or Mobile Application, the export directly into a new file in Microsoft Project is not supported. Therefore, with these interfaces, the export file is downloaded from Microsoft Dynamics NAV and then opened manually in Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: When using the Web Client or Mobile Application, the export directly into a new file in Microsoft Project is not supported.
Therefore, with these interfaces, the export file is downloaded from Microsoft Dynamics NAV and then opened manually in Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source:
Conclusion
An export with the right structure and without the additional options works very well. The export should be used for a better planning in Microsoft Project with the graphical tool. However, use caution with trying to match calendar entries and actual.

seg-source.mrk: Conclusion
An export with the right structure and without the additional options works very well.
The export should be used for a better planning in Microsoft Project with the graphical tool.
However, use caution with trying to match calendar entries and actual.

trans-unit.source: Import from Microsoft Project

seg-source.mrk: Import from Microsoft Project

trans-unit.source: This section explains the considerations for importing from Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: This section explains the considerations for importing from Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source: Limitation

seg-source.mrk: Limitation

trans-unit.source: Considerations

seg-source.mrk: Considerations

trans-unit.source: Structures

seg-source.mrk: Structures

trans-unit.source: Existing structures in cc|project must match the structures in Microsoft Project before data is imported.

seg-source.mrk: Existing structures in cc|project must match the structures in Microsoft Project before data is imported.

trans-unit.source: During the import, cc|project tries to find every task using of the following mechanisms:

seg-source.mrk: During the import, cc|project tries to find every task using of the following mechanisms:

trans-unit.source: Import is based on a former export.

seg-source.mrk: Import is based on a former export.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the structure information has been sent to Microsoft Project before. Therefore, cc|project can find the position exactly.

seg-source.mrk: In this case, the structure information has been sent to Microsoft Project before.
Therefore, cc|project can find the position exactly.

trans-unit.source: New positions the system can find by hierarchical structures only

seg-source.mrk: New positions the system can find by hierarchical structures only

trans-unit.source: In this case, the exact position is not unique. Maybe a transfer of this position to another hierarchical structure is needed.

seg-source.mrk: In this case, the exact position is not unique.
Maybe a transfer of this position to another hierarchical structure is needed.

trans-unit.source: Components

seg-source.mrk: Components

trans-unit.source: In Microsoft Project there are no components because it is not an ERP system. This can be handled using a preset default component for all import lines. For example, enter “Type” and “No.” in Microsoft Project because there are extended fields for that purpose.

seg-source.mrk: In Microsoft Project there are no components because it is not an ERP system.
This can be handled using a preset default component for all import lines.
For example, enter “Type” and “No.” in Microsoft Project because there are extended fields for that purpose.

trans-unit.source: But, this requires careful management.

seg-source.mrk: But, this requires careful management.

trans-unit.source: Cost and Profit Planning

seg-source.mrk: Cost and Profit Planning

trans-unit.source: Cost information cannot be transferred with the interface. The purpose of the interface is for planning. For all cost issues, cc|project is the master system.

seg-source.mrk: Cost information cannot be transferred with the interface.
The purpose of the interface is for planning.
For all cost issues, cc|project is the master system.

trans-unit.source: Resources

seg-source.mrk: Resources

trans-unit.source: cc|project detects resources by the Code field (a standard field in Microsoft Project in the Resource table).

seg-source.mrk: cc|project detects resources by the Code field (a standard field in Microsoft Project in the Resource table).

trans-unit.source: Resources that do not exist in cc|project but have been created in Microsoft Project can be imported, but this is not advised under normal circumstances because:

seg-source.mrk: Resources that do not exist in cc|project but have been created in Microsoft Project can be imported, but this is not advised under normal circumstances because:

trans-unit.source: The available persons should be defined within cc|project.

seg-source.mrk: The available persons should be defined within cc|project.

trans-unit.source: Capacities of these persons have to be calculated in cc|project.

seg-source.mrk: Capacities of these persons have to be calculated in cc|project.

trans-unit.source: All data may be duplicated unnecessarily in cc|project.

seg-source.mrk: All data may be duplicated unnecessarily in cc|project.

trans-unit.source: Calendar

seg-source.mrk: Calendar

trans-unit.source: Importing data from an external system creates an issue of the leading system. In cc|project, the calendar is organized. Normally it is not necessary to define it externally.

seg-source.mrk: Importing data from an external system creates an issue of the leading system.
In cc|project, the calendar is organized.
Normally it is not necessary to define it externally.

trans-unit.source: An external calendar can be imported if necessary and it will be used to calculate the processes. However, an external calendar cannot be imported with exception days because there is no structure for this in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: An external calendar can be imported if necessary and it will be used to calculate the processes.
However, an external calendar cannot be imported with exception days because there is no structure for this in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Assignments

seg-source.mrk: Assignments

trans-unit.source: Assignments are the resources to be linked with the processes.

seg-source.mrk: Assignments are the resources to be linked with the processes.

trans-unit.source: These assignments can be imported from an external system. Alternatively, complete the assignments in cc|project.

seg-source.mrk: These assignments can be imported from an external system.
Alternatively, complete the assignments in cc|project.

trans-unit.source: Calendar Entries

seg-source.mrk: Calendar Entries

trans-unit.source: All existing calendar entries (except those with Schedule Type = Fixed) in cc|project will be deleted if calendar entries are imported from Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: All existing calendar entries (except those with Schedule Type = Fixed) in cc|project will be deleted if calendar entries are imported from Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source:
Conclusion
For processes, predecessor links, Start, Finish and initial resource assignments (for existing resources) the import is very practical. All additional options need careful consideration so as to avoid unexpected planning conflicts.

seg-source.mrk: Conclusion
For processes, predecessor links, Start, Finish and initial resource assignments (for existing resources) the import is very practical.
All additional options need careful consideration so as to avoid unexpected planning conflicts.

trans-unit.source: MSP Codes

seg-source.mrk: MSP Codes

trans-unit.source: The MSP Code manages all the settings that are necessary for the interface with Microsoft Project. These codes are set up in the MSP Codes page, accessed from the Job Card or the Job Budget Calculation view, each by clicking  Navigate > MSP Codes.

seg-source.mrk: The MSP Code manages all the settings that are necessary for the interface with Microsoft Project.
These codes are set up in the MSP Codes page, accessed from the Job Card or the Job Budget Calculation view, each by clicking  Navigate > MSP Codes.

trans-unit.source: Fig. 6 displays the lines exported from cc|project to Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: Fig. 6 displays the lines exported from cc|project to Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source: : Exported lines from cc|project into Microsoft Project

seg-source.mrk: : Exported lines from cc|project into Microsoft Project

trans-unit.source: During the transfer, Microsoft Project performs independent calculation processes, which results in messages and errors. It is important to review this information to ensure optimal matching of the logic between the systems.

seg-source.mrk: During the transfer, Microsoft Project performs independent calculation processes, which results in messages and errors.
It is important to review this information to ensure optimal matching of the logic between the systems.

trans-unit.source: No errors were found but there are some messages (as indicated by the envelope and question mark icon () in the Indicators field and the underlined dates in the Finish field).

seg-source.mrk: No errors were found but there are some messages (as indicated by the envelope and question mark icon () in the Indicators field and the underlined dates in the Finish field).

trans-unit.source: Many changes can be made to address the issues. In this example, the following amendments were applied:

seg-source.mrk: Many changes can be made to address the issues.
In this example, the following amendments were applied:

trans-unit.source: Manufacturing 1 was set to auto-schedule and therefore moved the finish date to March 28, 2017

seg-source.mrk: Manufacturing 1 was set to auto-schedule and therefore moved the finish date to March 28, 2017

trans-unit.source: Manufacturing 2 and 3 were reassigned to Thorsten Scholl, resource P013

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Save the Microsoft Project File for Import

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Save the Microsoft Project File for Import

trans-unit.source: Data from Microsoft Project must be saved as an XML file in order to import into cc|project.

seg-source.mrk: Data from Microsoft Project must be saved as an XML file in order to import into cc|project.

trans-unit.source: To save the Microsoft Project file for import, follow these steps:

seg-source.mrk: To save the Microsoft Project file for import, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Once planning is ready for import back into Microsoft Dynamics NAV, click File > Save As.

seg-source.mrk: Once planning is ready for import back into Microsoft Dynamics NAV, click File > Save As.

trans-unit.source: Select the path to save the file.

seg-source.mrk: Select the path to save the file.

trans-unit.source: Update the File name as needed.

seg-source.mrk: Update the File name as needed.

trans-unit.source: In the Save as type field, click the drop-down arrow and select XML Format (*.xml).

seg-source.mrk: In the Save as type field, click the drop-down arrow and select XML Format (*.xml).

trans-unit.source: Click Save.

seg-source.mrk: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Close Microsoft Project without saving changes.

seg-source.mrk: Close Microsoft Project without saving changes.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, a macro for saving as XML can be created in Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: Alternatively, a macro for saving as XML can be created in Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source: Data Import to cc|project

seg-source.mrk: Data Import to cc|project

trans-unit.source: Once saved as XML file, the data can be imported into cc|project from the following pages:

seg-source.mrk: Once saved as XML file, the data can be imported into cc|project from the following pages:

trans-unit.source: MSP Codes (Navigate tab)

seg-source.mrk: MSP Codes (Navigate tab)

trans-unit.source: Job Budget Calculation (Navigate tab)

seg-source.mrk: Job Budget Calculation (Navigate tab)

trans-unit.source: Planning Processes (Job Planning and Processing > Per Block > Home tab)

seg-source.mrk: Planning Processes (Job Planning and Processing > Per Block > Home tab)

trans-unit.source: To start the import process in the Planning Processes page, click MS Project Import on the ribbon.

seg-source.mrk: To start the import process in the Planning Processes page, click MS Project Import on the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: : MSP Import Options

seg-source.mrk: : MSP Import Options

trans-unit.source: In the MSP Import Options dialog, select the Import Assignments with Res. check box to import assignments (tasks) with resources from Microsoft Project.

seg-source.mrk: In the MSP Import Options dialog, select the Import Assignments with Res.
check box to import assignments (tasks) with resources from Microsoft Project.

trans-unit.source: After Import the lines are updated with the finish date of Manufacturing 1 set to March 28, 2017 and Manufacturing 2 and Manufacturing 3 also include resource P013.

seg-source.mrk: After Import the lines are updated with the finish date of Manufacturing 1 set to March 28, 2017 and Manufacturing 2 and Manufacturing 3 also include resource P013.

trans-unit.source: : Imported entries into cc|project from Microsoft Project

seg-source.mrk: : Imported entries into cc|project from Microsoft Project

trans-unit.source: Based on new Start and Finish dates, a new planning can now be calculated in the following two steps:

seg-source.mrk: Based on new Start and Finish dates, a new planning can now be calculated in the following two steps:

trans-unit.source: Delete existing planning (planned scheduled entries reduce the resource availability) by clicking Delete Schedule Entries on the ribbon of the Planning Processes page.

seg-source.mrk: Delete existing planning (planned scheduled entries reduce the resource availability) by clicking Delete Schedule Entries on the ribbon of the Planning Processes page.

trans-unit.source: New Scheduling – Select the Project Deadline position and then click Actions > Schedule (with links) > Schedule Processes.

seg-source.mrk: New Scheduling – Select the Project Deadline position and then click Actions > Schedule (with links) > Schedule Processes.
